newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi riyal interbank deposits move up this week.
newsitem.headline: Saudi riyal interbank deposits move up this week.

text.p: Saudi riyal interbank deposits moved between 1/16 and 1/8 point higher in the week to Thursday, in line with upward pressure in the swap market, dealers said.
"This week riyal deposits went up because swaps were quoted higher," one Riyadh-based trader said.
One-month deposits were at 5-1/2, 3/8 from 5-7/16, 5/16. Three-months were at 5-5/8, 1-2 percent from 5-9/16, 7/16.
Six-month funds were at 5-3/4, 5/8 from 5-5/8, 1/2 percent and one year deposits were at 5-7/8, 3/4 from 5-13/16, 11/16.
The spot Saudi riyal was stable on the dollar at 3.7503/7.
